result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 22CF195

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample within 30 days. 
Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. 
4 days credit if probation is revoked.

defendant.name: Kauffmann, Isaac Paul
defendant.address: 217 S. Piety Street Apt. B, PO Box 942, Ellsworth, WI 54011

records.addlTxt: Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission
2 years

2:40 PM Defendant Isaac Paul Kauffmann in court.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court for Isaac Paul Kauffmann.  Attorney Kaley Walker in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CF25, 22CF44 and 22CF195. ADA walker: guilty to Ct#1 in 22CF25 w/ 2 years DJOC. guilty to Ct#2 in 22CF25 without repeater enhancer 2 years probation w/ court costs ($543) restitution $128 plus 10% surcharge. Dismiss 22CF44. guilty to Ct#3 in 22CF195 w/1 year probation: court costs ($543).Atty Nelson and Def agree. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights  Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#2 w/out repeater enhancer in 22CF25 and Ct#3 in 22Cf195. Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds Def guilty of Ct#1 and Ct#2 w/o repeater enhancer in 22CF25 and guilty to Ct#3 in 22CF195, dismiss 22CF44 and Ct#1-2 in 22CF195. ADA Walker and Atty Nelson address sentencing. Court orders S/W 2 years probation on Ct#2 in 22CF25; court costs ($543), $128 restitution w/ 10% surcharge. Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. Provide DNA sample within 30 days. 4 days credit if probation is revoked.  Court orders S/W 1 year probation Ct#3 in 22CF195: court costs ($543), Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. Provide DNA sample within 30 days. 0 days credit. Court withholds judgment of conviction in favor of the 2 year DJOC on Ct#1 in 22CF25. Court approves the terms/conditions of the DJOC. Defendant to report to probation today. Defendant to remain until handed a signed copy of the DJOC .Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 3:09
Plea hearing on September 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.

3:19 PM Defendant Isaac Paul Kauffmann appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin. DE does not qualify for PD.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights.
